lead_paragraph: United Nations officials were dumbfounded by the airstrike, which occurred after the Syrian military declared that a partial cease-fire was over.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, Michael R. Gordon from New York, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations. Reporting was contributed by Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva; Helene Cooper from Washington; Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon; Sophia Kishkovsky from Moscow; and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT, MICHAEL R. GORDON and SOMINI SENGUPTA

headline.print_headline: U.S. Ties Russia to Strike on U.N. Convoy in Syria
headline.main: U.S. Officials Say Russia Probably Attacked U.N. Humanitarian Convoy

snippet: United Nations officials were dumbfounded by the airstrike, which occurred after the Syrian military declared that a partial cease-fire was over....
abstract: American officials say Russia was likely responsible for bombing of United Nations humanitarian aid convoy in Syria, which killed at least 12 people, further dismantling remains of already weakened agreement aimed at ending war there; UN, calling act possible war crime, halts all aid convoys to Syria.
